<title level="1" pfs="">[Murder Of Crows](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2300)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 31

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 9">[Murder Of Crows](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2300)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Animal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=9" />
<trait label="Swarm" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=239" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Adventure Path](/Sources.aspx?ID=150) pg. 257</row>

**Perception** +19; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23)

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +19, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +19

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +0

**Dex** +6

**Con** +4

**Int** -4

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +0
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 27 

**Fort** +7 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +9 

</row>

**HP** 150

**Immunities**
precision, swarm mind

**Resistances**
bludgeoning 5, piercing 10, slashing 10

**Weaknesses**
area damage 10, splash damage 10

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 10 feet, fly 40 feet

**Enraged Cunning**   A murder of crows can get past most barriers to hound their prey. Simple latches, unsecured chimney flues, loosely shuttered windows, and similar obstacles rarely keep a murder away. A murder of crows automatically bypasses many of these simple obstructions and can attempt a DC 25 Thievery check to get through more complex obstructions (such as closed windows or simple barricades).

**Swarming Beaks** <actions string="Single Action" />  The crows' angry pecking deals 2d8 piercing damage to each enemy in the swarm's space (DC 28 basic Reflex save). A creature that critically fails its save is blinded for 1d6 rounds as the crows focus their attacks on the target's vulnerable face.

</column>
name: Murder Of Crows

text: Murder Of Crows Recall Knowledge - Animal (Nature): DC 31 Unspecific Lore : DC 29 Specific Lore : DC 26 Murder Of Crows Source Kingmaker Adventure Path pg. 257 Perception +19; low-light vision Languages Skills Acrobatics +19, Thievery +19 Str +0 Dex +6 Con +4 Int -4 Wis +6 Cha +0 --- AC 27 Fort +7 Ref +12 Will +9 HP 150 Immunities precision, swarm mind Resistances bludgeoning 5, piercing 10, slashing 10 Weaknesses area damage 10, splash damage 10 --- Speed 10 feet, fly 40 feet Enraged Cunning A murder of crows can get past most barriers to hound their prey. Simple latches, unsecured chimney flues, loosely shuttered windows, and similar obstacles rarely keep a murder away. A murder of crows automatically bypasses many of these simple obstructions and can attempt a DC 25 Thievery check to get through more complex obstructions (such as closed windows or simple barricades). Swarming Beaks Single Action The crows' angry pecking deals 2d8 piercing damage to each enemy in the swarm's space (DC 28 basic Reflex save). A creature that critically fails its save is blinded for 1d6 rounds as the crows focus their attacks on the target's vulnerable face.
